column5: Hey all  So the mrs says to me tonight that for our 12 YR we need to do something and if all works out i can get some fishing in.  Any idea's close (2 hour drive time) from Whitby?  We have been to the Niagara area before and no need to go back so any ideas are welcome, cheers.  Geoff
I'd drive futher than 2 hours for a ........ .. Just sayin...
One possibility http://www.bbcanada.com/associations/stjacobs/

You might want to try the Prince Edward County area, there are a number of places. Some of the wineries in the county have accommodations and restaurants. The county tourism web site seems to be down at the moment, I couldn't get it to open.

One of my favourite places to go, although more then the 2 hours you are looking at. Bob and Peg are terrific hosts. Down fall is you are a bit of a drive to anything for dinner. Sudbury gives you some choices but you cannot beat "The Bus" in Killarney for fish and chips.  Whispering Pines On The Bay   Here's my report from a few years ago. (Woodgrange B&B doesn't have a listing anymore, maybe just closed for the winter )  Report    Of course you can search BBCanada . Been using that site for years and must have stayed in 30+ B&B's over the years, never had a bad experience.  Another one that is a bit closer to your 2 hour range is Inks Spot B&B in Huntsville.  Family weekend fun a couple of years ago Report  Any questions, fire away.

Hey Geoff,  OOD Magazine had a writer's retreat two falls ago at Elmhirst Resort - on the shores of Rice Lake. Your own cottage on the water, wonderful restaurant, acres of hiking trails and rolling hills, horseback riding, a spa...plus, all the fishing you want.  I had a great experience - thought I'd pass the recommendation on.  http://www.elmhirst.ca  Cheers,  Justin
If all the girls lived in the sky.....Wayne would surely learn to fly........... Wait.....he already knows how to fly.  Carry on then
Less then 2 hours away... but check this place out Geoff...   the wife will love it! trust me, and you can fish as well  http://www.thecranberryresort.com/   G.

There is that couples resort in Whitney.  I have never been there but a broad I know convinced her husband to take her and they had a great time.  Just google couples resort Whitney. Should pop right up.
Couples Resort in Whitney
That's the one!

Thanks all, going to check into them later with the Mrs to see what she likes. G, been there and we both didn't like it but thanks. Justin, I checked that real quick for 1 thing and 1 thing only, boat rentals...  LOL  Ok, make it 2, she get's a spa treatment while I get to fish I'll check in later too so if anyone else has more to add, have at'er!  Thanks! Geoff
Maybe I missed it.......but did you mention the exact time of year....could really make a difference where I would recommend ???
wow really? lets just say it is a goodthing CSI has not found a need to use the Blue light in the rooms I have been in!
May 6 or dang close

Langdon Hall in Cambridge.  Their continental breakfast is ridiculous and their restaurant has been rated as one of the best in the World.  Beautiful property with gardens and trails.  Right near the Grand too.  Fishing for you, and they have a spa for the wife as well.  http://www.langdonhall.ca/index.htm
Well, an update for you all...  She picked Elmhirst based on the web site and chat she had with someone there.  Thanks Justin! And thanks to all that offered ideas too!
Maybe get your float rating while you're there... oh.. you need a pilot's licence first! lol Have fun...
Good stuff, Geoff - you guys will have a great time! The meals were delicious...  Now, about that finder's fee Elmhirst mentioned..haha!  Cheers,  Justin
Elmhirst is a very nice resort. Now all you have to do is convince your wife to go May 12 so you can target walleye...
And great wings at the pub in Bewdley. I know yiu picked already by Stouffermill B+B on Hall's lake. Her cooking will blow your mind.
